title: NIH Collaborative International Research Project (Parent PF5 Clinical Trial Optional)
amount: Funding will be provided for international collaborations; specific award amounts (minimum and maximum) are not specified in this document.
summary: 米国国立衛生研究所（NIH）は、そのミッションを支援する強力で生産的かつ安全な国際共同研究プロジェクトを募集しています。この公募は、国内の主要機関が独立した外国機関と連携する形で、国際共同研究に資金を提供することを目的としています。この枠組みにより、NIHは国際的な資金提供を監督し、追跡することができます。応募には少なくとも1つの国際サブプロジェクトを含める必要があり、提案されたプロジェクトは参加するNIHの各機関・センター・オフィスの科学的ミッションに関連している必要があります。このプロジェクトは、米国では容易に利用できない、または既存の米国リソースを補完するような、他国での特別な才能、資源、人口、または環境条件を活用して研究プログラムを進展させる特別な機会を提供するかどうかが、総合的に評価されます。また、提案がNIHのミッションと目的に特に関連し、米国の健康科学を大きく進歩させる可能性を持つかどうかも評価の対象となります。
description: The National Institutes of Health (NIH) seeks to advance its mission by maintaining strong, productive, and secure international research collaborations in support of the NIH mission. The NIH Collaborative International Research Project (Parent Announcement) supports international research collaborations. This opportunity specifically implements an award structure of prime domestic awards with independent foreign awards that are linked to the prime. This structure provides NIH with oversight capacity for international collaborations, and allows NIH to track international funding, as identified in... NOT-OD-25-104. This funding opportunity is specifically designed for NIH to support funded international collaborations between a domestic prime organization and foreign organizations. This NOFO should not be used for foreign consultants, purchasing unique equipment or supplies from foreign vendors, foreign collaborations that do not involve NIH funding or any other foreign component that would not result in a foreign subaward. All collaborative international research project applications must include at least 1 international subproject. The proposed project must be related to the programmatic interests of one or more of the participating NIH Institutes, Centers and Offices (ICOs) based on their scientific missions. The application will be evaluated as a whole, and the international subproject(s) will be evaluated on whether the project presents special opportunities for furthering research programs through the use of unusual talent, resources, populations, or environmental conditions in other countries that are not readily available in the United States or that augment existing United States resources, and whether the proposed project has specific relevance to the mission and objectives of the ICO and has the potential for significantly advancing the health sciences in the United States.
keywords: International Research, Collaborations, Clinical Trial, Health, Research Support, NIH mission
researchEndDate: The scope of the proposed project should determine the project period. Generally, the maximum project period is 5 years for non-clinical trial(s) and up to 7 years for clinical trial(s).

title: Single Source Renewal for the Continuation of the Liver Cirrhosis Network: Scientific and Data Coordination Center (U24 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary: 米国国立衛生研究所（NIH）の国立糖尿病・消化器・腎臓病研究所（NIDDK）が、肝硬変ネットワークの科学およびデータ調整センターの継続のため、単一ソースによる更新申請を募集する公募。この申請はピアレビューされ、適格な組織からの応募が招待されます。
description:
The National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK) of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is seeking a Single Source renewal application to continue scientific service as the Scientific and Data Coordination Center for the Liver Cirrhosis Network. The application will be peer-reviewed and if it is not a meritorious application, it will not be funded. This is a Notice of Funding Opportunity (NOFO) for a Single Source that will invite application(s) from eligible organization(s) to apply. Please see Section III. Eligibility... for additional information. In accordance with NIH standard peer-review processes, the application(s) will be peer-reviewed, and only meritorious application(s) will be considered for funding.

Eligibility: Eligible applicants: Miscellaneous - Other. Refer to Section III. Eligibility Information within the NOFO for additional information on eligibility. Eligible Organizations: Only the following applicant is eligible to apply for this single source funding: Northwestern University. Please refer to Section I. Notice of Funding Opportunity Information for more details. Foreign Organizations/Foreign Collaborations: Non-domestic (non-U.S.) Entities (Foreign Organizations) are not eligible to apply. Non-domestic (non-U.S.) components of U.S. Organizations are not eligible to apply. Foreign components, as defined in the NIH Grants Policy Statement, are not allowed.
keywords: Liver Cirrhosis Network, Scientific and Data Coordination Center, U24 Clinical Trial, Single Source Renewal, National Institutes of Health, NIDDK, Diabetes, Digestive Diseases, Kidney Diseases, Health
field: Health, Diabetes, Digestive, and Kidney Diseases Extramural Research
